EmailTemplate.subject: Why Successful Businesses Care About Latency
EmailTemplate.textOnly:
Dear {{Lead.First Name}},
The numbers don’t lie—latency sucks…profits.
Consider the following:
You’ve done the research. Here’s a recap of what VMTurbo can do for you:
- Amazon found that 100 ms cost them 1% in sales. In terms of its 2014 revenue of $88.94 billion, 1% is $889,400,000. Not insignificant. - One study found that a 1 ms advantage can be worth $100,000,000 to a major brokerage firm. - It’s so costly that $1.5 billion to lay the first trans-arctic ocean fiber optic cables in order to cut latency between London and Tokyo by 30% is a practically steal.
It’s no wonder then that businesses care about latency—and the successful ones are doing something about it.
A Principled Technologies study found that VMTurbo improved application performance through actionable recommendations—specifically cutting latency by 37%. The report details the methodology and results of the study . <http://vmturbo.com/wp-content/uploads/2014/04/Principled-Tech_Study_VMTurbo_performance_0315.pdf?utm_source=vmturbo&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=wp_love&utm_content=principled_report>
